node.title: After seven years of nothing, a William Tyrrell breakthrough â€” then more nothing
node.alt: a man searching through sand under a house and a little boy smiling
node.description: After seven long years, there was a flurry of excitement on the William Tyrrell search site in Kendall this week. Meanwhile, in Sydney, the case becomes personal between the state's top cop and a former detective.
node.content:
["After seven long years, a flurry of excitement.", "Police officers gathered round and a senior detective strode in, his hand clutching a Spider-Man suit.", "Two strands of red thread had been found in bush about 1 kilometre from where William Tyrrell was last seen.", "The suit was compared to the threads, which have been taken for forensic examination.", "But the ABC understands that was a formality and police have already ruled out any chance they'll unlock the case's secrets.", "William has not been seen since September 2014, when he disappeared from the front yard of his foster-grandmother's home at Kendall, on the NSW Mid-North Coast.", "So seldom have developments been since then, even the discovery of a tiny thread felt like a breakthrough, albeit briefly.", "", "
The ABC understands police have ruled out the strands of red thread found on Wednesday.(AAP: Mick Tsikas)
", "Police resumed searching on Monday and it's expected their probe, which will focus on three never-before-scoured sites, will take about three weeks.", "Professor David Ranson, from the Victorian Institute of Forensic Medicine, said technological advancements meant any evidence \u2014 no matter how small \u2014 would be crucial.", "\"It is remarkable how the modern techniques can work with poor-quality evidential material,\" he said.", "\"The better evidence you can get, the better chances you have.", "\"As we know from successful cold case investigations today, things that were mysteries historically are now getting solved.\"", "Take the infamous Claremont serial killer case, which reached its climax in Perth last year, for example.", "More than two decades after Bradley John Edwards murdered Jane Rimmer and Ciara Glennon, a lab analysis of 98 tiny fibres formed a critical link between the killer and his victims.", "The threads were barely visible to the naked eye but prosecutors described them as \"a significant part of the case\".", "Police investigating William Tyrrell's disappearance need something bigger first: a body.", "On Monday, police admitted for the first time that's what they were looking for, and said they were basing their efforts on new information.", "", "
NSW Police confirm they are now searching for a body.(Supplied: NSW Police)
", "Professor Ranson said even if William's remains were found, several factors would need to be considered in relation to what state they might be in after seven years.", "\"How were they wrapped? Are they in a sealed container or plastic? Were they decomposed before they were buried or not?", "\"What are the characteristics of the soil and the water flow in and around the grave?", "\"What about drainage issues or contaminated groundwater?", "\"It depends on these environmental factors.", "\"I've seen people who have been buried for a long time and still have tissue. I've also seen people that are just bones after a few months.\"", "Back in Sydney, the case became personal this week when NSW Police Commissioner Mick Fuller said \"time was wasted\" during the early years of the investigation into William's disappearance \"looking at some persons of interest\".", "", "
An expert says that cold cases have been solved due to improvements in forensic tools.\u00a0(Supplied: NSW Police)
", "Former lead detective Gary Jubelin, who was removed from the case in March 2019 and resigned from the force shortly afterwards, yesterday hit back, saying his team \"investigated every theory\" under his watch.", "The ABC understands William's foster-mother is now a person of interest in the investigation.\u00a0", "Officials have confirmed that being a person of interest does not mean someone is a suspect. She has always denied any involvement in William's disappearance", "There have been around 600 persons of interest over the course of the probe.", "Mr Jubelin told Nine radio he had previously eliminated the foster parents as persons of interest.", "\"Based on \u2026 the information that we gathered during the covert operation, they were again eliminated,\" he said.", "As light rain fell in Kendall yesterday afternoon, investigators and Rural Fire Service (RFS) volunteers covered their search sites in tarpaulins.", "They'll stop the operation if things become too wet, and a downpour is expected this weekend.", "After seven long years, another setback."]
